thread.title: WGEM SC Prep Athlete of the Week Ballot (Wk 8)
thread.title_full: WGEM SC Prep Athlete of the Week Ballot (Wk 8)

author: Josh Houchins
title: WGEM SC Prep Athlete of the Week Ballot (Wk 8)
text:
WGEM SC Prep Athlete of the Week Ballot (Wk 8) - WGEM.com: Quincy News, Weather, Sports, and Radio Member Center: What player deserves to win this week's Dene Lambkin Honda/Hyundai Prep Athlete of the Week award? (info about each player below) Dylan Bonk, Central (football) Lucas Booher, Liberty (cross country) Tory Bradshaw, Western (volleyball) Tyler Elledge, Mark Twain (football) Cameron Gay, QHS (football) 
Thank you for participating in our poll! The Dene Lambkin Honda/Hyundai... WGEM SC Prep Athlete of the Week Ballot (Wk 8) Posted: jhouchins@wgem.com 
Below is a list of the nominees for The Dene Lambkin Honda/Hyundai & WGEM SportsCenter Prep Athlete of the Week featuring Jason Deters . The fan vote counts as one vote in the total vote process with 10 sports broadcasters/writers submitting ballots as well. The winner will be announced Tuesday morning at 7:20 on WGEM SportsCenter -- ESPN 1440 AM, WGEM-AM app, or WGEM.com/sports. 
From Oct. 19 - Oct. 25 
Dylan Bonk (Central) -- Needing another win to become playoff eligible the back scampered for 135 yards and two touchdowns to defeat North Greene on the road. 
Lucas Booher (Liberty) -- On Tuesday, the cross country runner claimed the West Central Conference individual title with a time of 16:55 as his team took first place as well. On Saturday he finished fifth at the Class 1A Franklin Regional as the team came in second overall. 
Tory Bradshaw (Western) -- Named to the all-tournament team at the Pike County Conference Volleyball Tournament, the Wildcat led the team with 16 kills, three aces, and two blocks in the three-set title match win against Griggsville-Perry. She also had 14 kills, 12 digs, and three blocks the night prior against Pittsfield. 
Christian Downs (Rushville-Industry) -- A stellar win on the road to end the season at Farmington fell into the hands of Downs, who scored three times and accounted for 231 yards rushing on 20 carries. He also completed three passes for 30 yards. 
Brodie Dunker (Unity/Payson) -- A seventh win meant a home playoff game possibility and that's exactly what the Mustangs quarterback set out to accomplish by throwing for 281 yards and five scores to knock off playoff-bound Greenfield-Northwestern. 
Tyler Elledge (Mark Twain) -- Now 10-0 on the season, the Tigers used another dose of Elledge to advance to the second round of Class 1 districts. The back ran for 226 yards and three touchdowns to beat Chaffee. 
Cameron Gay (QHS) -- Speed kills and the Blue Devil displayed his to the max against QND, returning two punts for touchdowns in the second quarter to give the host team a commanding lead. He finished with 105 yards combined rushing and receiving. 
Eric Lubbert (QHS) -- In the crucial moments of the Class 3A regional title match at Flinn Stadium, the senior goalie made an amazing save in the first overtime to keep the score tied. Then his save on the third attempt in penalty-kick shootout kept the Blue Devils in the lead and eventually the win. 
Lauryn Schnack (QHS) -- The senior finished with 12 kills and four blocks in the second match Saturday to beat East Moline. Later in the day she had seven kills, two aces, and a block as the team not only beat Moline, but claimed its first Western Big 6 title since 2012. 
Andrew Schultz (Highland) -- In the comeback win of the night, the Cougars quarterback helped rallied his team with three unanswered scores to defeat Bowling Green in the first round of Class 2 districts by throwing for 244 yards and rushing for another 88. Can't Find Something? 513 Hampshire Quincy, IL 62301 Switchboard: (217) 228-6600
